questionText: (Man): I heard you're moving to New York. (Woman): Yes, I got a job at a law firm there. (Narrator): What does the woman mean?
optionA: She is going to New York for a vacation.
optionB: She found a new job in New York.
optionC: She is studying law in New York.
optionD: She is visiting a law firm.

questionText: (Woman): The history exam was incredibly difficult, wasn't it? (Man): You can say that again! (Narrator): What does the man mean?
optionA: He wants the woman to repeat the question.
optionB: He thinks the exam was easy.
optionC: He agrees that the exam was hard.
optionD: He has taken the exam twice.

questionText: (Man): Are you going to the library now? (Woman): I would, but I have a dentist appointment at three. (Narrator): What will the woman probably do next?
(Woman): I can't believe I forgot my wallet. (Man): Don't worry, I've got you covered for lunch. (Narrator): What does the man offer to do?
optionB: Go back to get her wallet.
optionC: Lend her some money for rent.
